subject: Art & Design
title: Punk Fashion: DIY Rebellion on the Body
description: A 60-second lesson on Punk Fashion: DIY Rebellion on the Body.

hook.text: Ripped jeans, safety pins, mohawks, and band patches. Punk fashion was designed to offend. That was the whole point.

buildup.text: 1970s punk rejected mainstream fashion entirely. If fashion said 'polish,' punk said 'destroy.

discovery.text: DIY was the philosophy: customize, rip, patch, and repurpose. Looking 'bad' on purpose was a deliberate skill.

twist.text: High fashion quickly co-opted punk. Versace used safety pins on a $10,000 dress. Rebellion was commodified.

climax.text: Every generation's youth movement borrows from punk: grunge, emo, streetwear.

punchline.text: Punk's greatest fashion statement: you don't need permission to be yourself.
